intro: Vatica mangachapoi subsp. hainanensis, commonly known as Hainan ironwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Hainan Island in China. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and sturdy, straight trunk, which makes it highly valued for timber. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is known for its slow growth and long lifespan. It typically grows in lowland to hill forest areas, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its ecological importance and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
